thread.title: Graphics outlining what Remain and Brexit votes will mean produced by Newcastle firm
thread.title_full: Graphics outlining what Remain and Brexit votes will mean produced by Newcastle firm

author: Graeme Whitfield
title: Graphics outlining what Remain and Brexit votes will mean produced by Newcastle firm
text:
Graphics outlining what Remain and Brexit votes will mean produced by Newcastle firm 18:30, 19 Jun 2016 By Graeme Whitfield Law firm Square One Law has produced the graphics to make clear what each vote would mean Shares Comments Get business news by email 
A North East law firm with a specialism in European law has produced graphical guides to the two possible outcomes in the EU referendum . 
Neil Warwick at Newcastle-based Square One Law has produced the two guides which lay out the potential outcomes of both a Remain and a Brexit vote. 
Mr Warwick is one of the region’s leading experts in European and competition law, and was on the panel at The Journal’s European breakfast debate earlier this year. 
The Brexit graphic highlights the four most likely outcomes of a vote to leave the EU, outlining what each potential model for the UK out of Europe would mean in terms of contributing to the EU budget, free movement of people and the UK’s influence on European regulations. 
The Remain graphic also outlines that there are a number of possible outcomes after this week’s vote, ranging from ‘busines as usual” to the UK working with the EU on further reforms or other European countries being unsettled by the referendum and pushing for further reforms. 
Voting in the referendum will take place on Thursday with many people still saying they are unsure about how cast their ballot, and many still saying they want more factual information on the two potential outcomes.
